Title: Illuminated Colophon with Two Goats in Combat
Medium: ink and pigments on colored and marbled paper with stenciled, painted, and illuminated designs
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] fī shar-i Muharram al-harām /1/ 115 /2/; [Translation] In the month of holy Muharram
Description: This colophon from Walters manuscript W.653 appears to have been partially erased, with only the following clearly legible: fi shar-i Muharram al-haram 115 (in the month of holy Muharram 1105 AH/AD 1693).
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Painting; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Iranian
